technology.short_description: Some hungry Ogre souls were born to serve the Great Maw.

effects.description: Offer to Great Maw cost: -20%
Winds of Magic cost: -5% for Lore of the Great Maw spells

technology.short_description: Keep 'em hungry, keep 'em mean.

related_attributes.bullet_text: When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.

effects.description: Attribute: Ogre Charge Upgraded for Ogre Infantry units

related_attributes.bullet_text: When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses a quarter of its charge bonus.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Ogre infantry units

technology.short_description: Scrolls appropriated from Cathay have revealed their deadly secrets…

effects.description: Ammunition: +10% for Ironblaster units
Range: +10% for Ironblaster units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Ironblaster units

technology.short_description: If you hit, throw and generally abuse them enough, Gnoblars occasionally have good ideas – in this instance, a Rhinox-drawn scoop for picking up all the scrap.

effects.description: Ammunition: +15% for Gnoblar Scraplauncher units
+2 additional projectiles for Scrap Launcher units

technology.short_description: These enormous, woolly beasts are notoriously dense, even by Ogre standards, and therefore require a bit of 'encouragement' in the breeding department.

effects.description: Army ability: "Thunder Charge"
Ward save: 10% for Stonehorn and Thundertusk units

technology.short_description: When several smaller Ogre camps become large enough and touch, a bigger gathering – a throng – is formed.

effects.description: Camp limit: +1
Camp limit: +1 for every level 5 camp built

technology.short_description: The only forms of currency Ogres will accept are food and gold. When many tribes are working together, agreeing on a standard is vital if healthy relations are to be maintained.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5%

technology.short_description: The long-abandoned fortresses of the, rarely, if ever-assailed Sky-Titans make ideal campsites for the brighter Ogre tribes.

effects.description: Population surplus: 1 for newly-captured settlements
Growth: +15

technology.short_description: The Maneaters have spent their long lives accumulating wealth abroad as mercenaries for foreign powers, giving them a nose for the best plunder and armaments.

effects.description: Enables Sundering attacks for Maneaters units
Armour-piercing missile damage: +10 for Maneater units
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +10 for Maneater units

technology.short_description: The Mournfang somehow find themselves ahead of the pack and ready to outflank the enemy. Was it careful planning or did they simply catch the aroma of a tasty meal?

effects.description: Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for Mournfang Cavalry units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Mournfang Cavalry units

technology.short_description: The natural musk of a mighty Mournfang, bizarrely, will attract other animals – ones you want to trap, kill and bung on a spit over the fire with haste.

effects.description: Unit mass: +20% for Mournfang Cavalry units
Charge bonus: +15 for Mournfang Cavalry units

technology.short_description: The unwanted cast-offs that have survived in the dark tunnels below the mountains have known nothing but hardship, but are all the stronger for it.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Gorgers units
Physical resistance: 15% for Gorgers units

technology.short_description: Gorgers like their meat raw or recently slaughtered, so the best kind of bait is the kind that's still wriggling.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Gorgefeast" for Gorger units
Bonus vs infantry: +5 for Gorgers units

technology.short_description: Spiked plates attached to the tusks or horns of great beasts make their already deadly swing all the deadlier.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Stonehorn and Thundertusk units
Weapon strength: +10% for Stonehorn and Thundertusk units

technology.short_description: Though it tends to lead to gut-aches and even-more-chronic flatulence than usual, there's sense in depriving the enemy of supplies, so they have to fight you in a weakened state.

effects.description: Control: -3 in enemy provinces where an army is present

Growth: -50 
	(armies in enemy region)

technology.short_description: Signalling that the several tribes that make up an Ogre kingdom are on the move, as a single, brutish, hungry horde.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%

technology.short_description: It's a bit fiddly, but some Ogres have a natural affinity for such things, and are able to make tents big enough to house a huddle or more.

effects.description: Camp limit: +1
Recruit rank: +2
Global recruitment capacity: +1
Local recruitment capacity: +1

technology.short_description: Whatever it is he's using to flavour the meat makes it taste nicer, and has some healing properties too.

effects.description: Plague immunity duration: 1 turns
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%

technology.short_description: While some Ogres take their camps and travel across the world, others know every inch of their mountainous homelands and rarely leave their birthplace.

effects.description: Might Makes Right commandment: additional +5% Income
Crude Ingenuity commandment: additional -10% recruitment cost
Feasts for the Strong commandment: additional +10 Growth

technology.short_description: It's important to discuss payment from the outset to prevent things going south at a later juncture.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -15% for Maneaters units
Local Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Maneater units (minimum 1)
Leadership: +5 for Maneater units

technology.short_description: Understanding that the Tyrant's tribute must be paid, no matter how well things went, is essential if you want to carry on living.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for all Ogre Infantry and Cavalry units
Recruit rank: +1 for all Ogre Infantry and Cavalry units

technology.short_description: Whether it be cannonballs, scrap metal or even picking up the cannon itself and using it like a club, Leadbelchers pack a *serious* punch.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +5% for Leadbelchers units
Missile strength: +5% for Leadbelchers units
Enables "Disoriented" contact effect (reduced speed melee defence and melee attack) for Leadbelchers units

technology.short_description: Leadbelchers will fire whatever is at hand at the foe, even grabbing the nearest Gnoblar and sending them flying!

effects.description: Ammunition: +10% for Leadbelchers units
Range: +5% for Leadbelchers units

technology.short_description: Be it by claw, talon or fang, the beasts of the Ogre Kingdoms tear through even the strongest of defences.

effects.description: Melee attack: +3 for Sabretusk Pack and Blood Vultures units
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +5 for Sabretusk Pack and Blood Vultures units

technology.short_description: Compared to the cramped, torturous conditions of their beastpens, the battlefield, however savage, is a refreshing break for these creatures.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Feral Rage" removed for Sabretusk Pack units
Leadership: +5 for Sabretusk Pack and Blood Vultures units

technology.short_description: Ogres have learnt to keep their mostly uncontrollable beasts under control, even when moving between camp locations.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for all Monster and Beast units
Recruit rank: +1 for Monster and Beast units

technology.short_description: Living in the mountains, Giants often have to bat off falling debris or the attacks of wild beasts, toughening their skin and flesh as a result of the scarring.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Monster and Beast units
Missile resistance: 10% for Monster and Beast units

technology.short_description: As it turns out, many of the Ogres' natural prey are a bit thick and can be tricked into giving up their lives without expending too much effort.

effects.description: [hidden] Used to increase rank for Hunters from camps in conjunction with regular effect (with different scopes)
Meat gained from battles: +10%
Hero capacity: +2 for Hunters
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Hunters

technology.short_description: Once you get a handle on the local food supply, things start to come together quite well, quite quickly, regardless of how far the Ogres are from home.

effects.description: Income from raiding: +25%
Income from sacking and looting settlements: +15%

technology.short_description: Applying Warpstone to steaks before cooking them keeps the number of mutations down.

effects.description: Chance of a plague spreading: -25%
Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from Chaos Undivided corruption and Chaos Wastes attrition

technology.short_description: Even Ogres know that keeping records of agreements can avoid the more violent forms of disagreement further down the track; simply sign your name with an 'X'.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +25 with all factions
Treasury reward from bounties: +50%

technology.short_description: Here, all the Ogres of the tribe sit together in one place to eat and make plans (chiefly, to eat even more).

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with Ogre Kingdoms
Lord recruit rank: +2

technology.short_description: When all is said and done, there's simply no place quite like home.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: The megalithic defences of this long-gone race were built into the mountains themselves. It's not completely beyond the Ogres to work out how to use them, but almost.

effects.description: Defensive supplies: +500 per turn when under siege
Control: +2 for regions with Garrison buildings
Hero capacity: +2 for Bruisers
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Bruisers

technology.short_description: Whether made of metal beaten into shape, hide-skins, cart wheels or bone, the thicker an Ogre’s gut plate, the better.

effects.description: Missile block chance: +15 for Ironfist units
Armour: +10 for Ogre Infantry

technology.short_description: Some mounts are disobedient and others are just plain dangerous, so it's sometimes necessary to "put a bit of stick about" to keep them in line and focused on the task at hand.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +5 for Crushers units
Attribute: Devastating Flanker for Crushers units

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

technology.short_description: Sharper weapons do more damage, something many Ogres learn from watching their Butcher at work.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Ogre Bulls and Ironguts units
Attribute: Unyielding Assault for Ogre Bull and Ironguts units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can never have its Melee Attack reduced during battle.

technology.short_description: Winding sinew around weapon handles makes for better grip, which in turn makes them easier to wield.

effects.description: Melee attack: +3 for Ogre Bulls and Ironguts units
Melee defence: +3 for Ogre Bulls and Ironguts units

technology.short_description: Between battles, Gnoblars are hot on their feet doing whatever their masters demand of them, lest they are turned into dinner.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -10% for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
Speed: +15% for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units

technology.short_description: Gnoblar Trappers delight in tormenting smaller animals and following Ogre Hunters into battle. Baiting them beforehand ensures that only the fastest, most intrepid candidates may attend.

effects.description: Cooldown: -25% to "Gnoblar Traps"

technology.short_description: To inflict maximum damage, Ogres might attach scrap metal, stone or even unsuspecting, live Gnoblars to a Giant's club.

effects.description: Enables "Dazed" contact effect (reduced Speed and Melee Defence) for Giant units
Weapon strength: +10% for Giant units

technology.short_description: When the creatures that live atop the Mountains of Mourn come down into the valleys, they find their stamina levels increased in the thicker air, as if their restraints had been lifted.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -25% for Monster and Beast units
	(own armies factionwide)

Speed: +15% for Monster and Beast units
	(own armies factionwide)

technology.short_description: A larger campsite means more groupings of tents, and therefore more Ogres gathered in one place – multiplying the threat level many times over.

effects.description: Camp limit: +1
Meat Construction Cost: -5%

technology.short_description: Gold is useful for opening ears to new ideas.

effects.description: Hero action cost: -10%
Hero action success chance: +10%

technology.short_description: Those pathetic, snivelling Gnoblars can be leashed and made to sniff out the best loot, and more of it too.

effects.description: Campaign line of sight: +20%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +10%

technology.short_description: At the heart of every camp lies the Mawtooth stone. The Ogres will fight harder, and with every last breath and ounce of strength, to ensure it is protected.

effects.description: Corruption: -2
Control: +1

technology.short_description: Simply promising not to eat the foreign envoys puts trade negotiations on a better footing from the outset.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +5 with all factions
Income from trade tariffs: +25%

technology.short_description: This one's not much of a talker, but more of an imposing presence who cracks his knuckles a lot, which speaks volumes to his opposite numbers.

effects.description: Tradable resources produced: +10%
Income from all non-camp buildings: +5%

technology.short_description: Eating crushed limestone reduces cases of 'Ogre Breath' enough so the Ogres can stand closer together and fight in ranks.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 for Ogre Bull units
Unit mass: +15% for Ogre Bull units

technology.short_description: While it's not unheard of, Ogres often don't eat their Gnoblar workers because they are "too stringy", a silver lining that puts most Gnoblars minds at ease.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
Melee defence: +3 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units

technology.short_description: Recipes and spells are scrawled upon the aprons of the Slaughtermasters and Butchers, steeping them in magic and causing them to absorb even more of the stuff.

effects.description: [hidden] Used to increase rank for Butcher from camps in conjunction with regular effect (with different scopes)
Hero capacity: +2 for Butchers
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Butchers
Ogre Camp buildings generate 5 Meat Per Turn

technology.short_description: The bigger the spit, the bigger the meal, the more satisfied the diners.

effects.description: Cooldown: -10% to Lore of the Great Maw spells
Offer to Great Maw cost: -10%

technology.short_description: A couple of Ogres having a conflab quickly becomes a huddle as more and more gather around them.

effects.description: Camp limit: +1

technology.short_description: Now, the Ogres can eat together – bringing a bit of decorum to proceedings, you might say. Almost.

effects.description: Growth: +15

technology.short_description: The volcanic peak kills many when it erupts, so making sure the Fire Mouth gods are appeased should be high on any self-respecting leader's list of things to do.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for the Fire Shrine and Fire Cave buildings

Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(own armies factionwide)

technology.short_description: "The Firebellies are comin' – time for a feast! Who's for some flametoad and devilpepper curry?"

effects.description: [hidden] Used to increase rank for Firebellies from camps in conjunction with regular effect (with different scopes)
Hero capacity: +2 for Firebellies
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Firebellies

Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Fire spells
	(own armies factionwide)
